page.title: 17GAMES FOR CHILDREN
page.content: When my mum was younger she used to play whip and top, which is a top which you whip to keep spinning. Hopscotch is a game where you throw a stone onto a square and you hop in every square except the one with the stone in. When my dad was younger he used to play hide and seek which is where some people hide and one person counts to a certain number then comes to find you. Fox and hounds is where one person hides and others chase or find them. I play tiggy, where somebody is on and has to chase after people and tig them. Computer games are games on a T.V. played by pressing keys on a keyboard or by moving a joystick. Andrew Sharpe
